member.name: IDefaultFolderMenuInitialize.GetMenuRestrictions
member.summary: Gets shortcut menu restrictions that are currently set for the object.
member.param: A bitwise combination of the values that specify the mask of the restrictions to get.
A bitwise combination of the values that specify the restrictions.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDefaultFolderMenuInitialize.Initialize
member.summary: Sets context menu info for the object.
member.param: A handle to the shortcut menu.
The address of the object that defines the callback for the shortcut menu.
The address of an item identifier list that specifies the folder of the items. If NULL, this is computed from the psf parameter.
The count of items in the apidl parameter.
A pointer to an array of PIDL structures, each of which is an item to be operated on.
The address of an object that specifies where to load extensions from.
The count of items in the aKeys parameter. May be zero.
Specifies where to load extensions from.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDefaultFolderMenuInitialize.SetHandlerClsid
member.summary: Sets the shortcut menu handler for the object.
member.param: The CLSID for the object defines the shortcut menu handler.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDefaultFolderMenuInitialize.SetMenuRestrictions
member.summary: Sets shortcut menu restrictions for the object.
member.param: A bitwise combination of the values that specify the restrictions to set.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Provides methods used to get and set shortcut menu information. This information is the same as that provided to through the structure.
summary.div: Note Do not use this method to reinitialize a shortcut menu; use instead.
